==!MudVolley Tutorials==

The !MudVolley Tutorials are the main JGF tutorials. Through this courses you will build a small game with JGF and evolve it through several steps.

1 - [Tutorial1 JGF: Mudvolley Tutorial]
2 - [Tutorial2 Debugging (Debug, Stats, SystemInfoComponent, AxisGrid, Screenshot)]
3 - [Tutorial3 Loaders (model loader, scene loader, entity loader?)]
4 - [Tutorial4 Introduction states]
5 - [Tutorial5 Settings and Settings Dialogs and Settings Storage]
6 - [Tutorial6 Menus]
7 - [Tutorial7 HUD]
8 - [Tutorial8 Console]
9 - [Tutorial9 Network]
10 - [Tutorial10 Packaging]

==Test Applications==

The following applications are included to test different components and to serve as examples. Click on their names to read the corresponding component information in the [UserGuide User Guide].

  * [Box] - The simplest minimum example of a JGF application.

  * [Console] - How to use JGF console.
  * [Fader] - How to use the !FaderView node to apply a fade-in and fade-out effect.
  * [GameStateWrapper] - Wraps JME !GameStates into JGF !ViewStates.
  * [Menu] - Tests the (simple) default menu system.

==JGF Base Game Structure==

A base game with a basic structure is provided to make starting a new project a cut-and-paste matter.

==Tanks Game==

A complete game is provided with with JGF: [Tanks]. Follow the link to find out the details.
